item.title: Megan add a quote by Jorge Luis Borges
item.description: "You have wakened not out of sleep, but into a prior dream, and that dream lies within another, and so on, to infinity, which is the number of grains of sand. The path that you are to take is endless, and you will die before you have truly awakened." -- Jorge Luis Borges

item.title: Megan add a quote by Jorge Luis Borges
item.description: "In the critic's vocabulary, the word "precursor" is indispensable, but it should be cleansed of all connotations of polemic or rivalry. The fact is that every writer creates his own precursors. His work modifies our conception of the past, as it will modify the future." -- Essay: "Kafka and his Precursors" -- Jorge Luis Borges

item.title: Megan add a quote by Jorge Luis Borges
item.description: "No one is anyone, one single immortal man is all men. Like Cornelius Agrippa, I am god, I am hero, I am philosopher, I am demon and I am world, which is a tedious way of saying that I do not exist." -- Jorge Luis Borges

item.title: Megan add a quote by Jorge Luis Borges
item.description: "Thus my life is a flight and I lose everything and everything belongs to oblivion, or to him." -- Jorge Luis Borges

item.title: Megan add a quote by Jorge Luis Borges
item.description: "A man sets out to draw the world. As the years go by, he peoples a space with images of provinces, kingdoms, mountains, bays, ships, islands, fishes, rooms, instruments, stars, horses, and individuals. A short time before he dies, he discovers that the patient labyrinth of lines traces the lineaments of his own face." -- Jorge Luis Borges

item.title: Megan add a quote by Jorge Luis Borges
item.description: "Let neither tear nor reproach besmirch this declaration of the mastery of God who, with magnificent irony, granted me both the gift of books and the night." -- Jorge Luis Borges

item.title: Megan add a quote by Jorge Luis Borges
item.description: "A book is more than a verbal structure or series of verbal structures; it is the dialogue it establishes with its reader and the intonation it imposes upon his voice and the changing and durable images it leaves in his memory. A book is not an isolated being: it is a relationship, an axis of innumerable relationships." -- Jorge Luis Borges

item.title: Megan add a quote by Jorge Luis Borges
item.description: "To refute him is to become contaminated with unreality." -- Jorge Luis Borges

item.title: Megan add a quote by Jorge Luis Borges
item.description: "It may be that universal history is the history of the different intonations given a handful of metaphors." -- Jorge Luis Borges

item.title: Megan add a quote by Percy Bysshe Shelley
item.description: "Know what it is to be a child? It is to be something very different from the man of today. It is to have a spirit yet streaming from the waters of Baptism; it is to believe in belief; it is to be so little that elves can reach to whisper in your ear; it is to turn pumpkins into coaches, and mice into horses, lowness into loftiness, and nothing into everything, for each child had its fairy godmother in its soul." -- Percy Bysshe Shelley

item.title: Megan add a quote by Percy Bysshe Shelley
item.description:
"<b>Ozymandias</b>
I met a traveller from an antique land Who said: "Two vast and trunkless legs of stone Stand in the desert. Near them on the sand, Half sunk, a shattered visage lies, whose frown And wrinkled lip and sneer of cold command Tell that its sculptor well those passions read Which yet survive, stamped on these lifeless things, The hand that mocked them and the heart that fed. And on the pedestal these words appear: 'My name is Ozymandias, King of Kings: Look on my works, ye mighty, and despair!' Nothing beside remains. Round the decay Of that colossal wreck, boundless and bare, The lone and level sands stretch far away." -- Percy Bysshe Shelley

item.title: Megan add a quote by Mary Shelley
item.description: "With how many things are we on the brink of becoming acquainted, if cowardice or carelessness did not restrain our inquiries." -- Mary Shelley

item.title: Megan add a quote by Percy Bysshe Shelley
item.description: "Our sweetest songs are those of saddest thought." -- Percy Bysshe Shelley

item.title: Megan add a quote by Percy Bysshe Shelley
item.description: "A poet is a nightingale who sits in darkness and sings to cheer its own solitude with sweet sounds." -- Percy Bysshe Shelley

item.title: Megan add a quote by Percy Bysshe Shelley
item.description: "Whatever may be his [man's] true and final destination, there is a spirit within him at enmity with nothingness and dissolution (change and extinction). This is the character of all life and being - each is at once the centre and the circumference; the point to which all things are contained. - "On Life" -- Percy Bysshe Shelley

item.title: Megan add a quote by Bernard M. Baruch
item.description: "Be who you are and say what you feel, because those who mind don't matter, and those who matter don't mind." -- Bernard M. Baruch

item.title: Megan add a quote by William W. Purkey
item.description: "You've gotta dance like there's nobody watching, Love like you'll never be hurt, Sing like there's nobody listening, And live like it's heaven on earth." -- William W. Purkey

item.title: Megan add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "Don't cry because it's over, smile because it happened." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Megan add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "No one can make you feel inferior without your consent." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Megan add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "If you tell the truth, you don't have to remember anything." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Megan add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "Don't walk behind me; I may not lead. Don't walk in front of me; I may not follow. Just walk beside me and be my friend." -- Albert Camus

item.title: Megan add a quote by Frank Zappa
item.description: "So many books, so little time." -- Frank Zappa

item.title: Megan add a quote by Maurice Switzer
item.description: "It is better to remain silent at the risk of being thought a fool, than to talk and remove all doubt of it." -- Maurice Switzer

item.title: Megan add a quote by Narcotics Anonymous
item.description: "Insanity is doing the same thing, over and over again, but expecting different results." -- Narcotics Anonymous

item.title: Megan add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "The man who does not read has no advantage over the man who cannot read." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Megan add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "You know you're in love when you can't fall asleep because reality is finally better than your dreams." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Megan add a quote by Mae West
item.description: "You only live once, but if you do it right, once is enough." -- Mae West

item.title: Megan add a quote by Elie Wiesel
item.description: "The opposite of love is not hate, it's indifference. The opposite of art is not ugliness, it's indifference. The opposite of faith is not heresy, it's indifference. And the opposite of life is not death, it's indifference." -- Elie Wiesel

item.title: Megan add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "I am so clever that sometimes I don't understand a single word of what I am saying." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Megan add a quote by Martin Luther King Jr.
item.description: "Darkness cannot drive out darkness: only light can do that. Hate cannot drive out hate: only love can do that." -- Martin Luther King Jr.
